carousel_items: Don't use bandages that restrict airflow over the area where you apply the medication (unless your doctor tells you to).
Can slow down skin healing.
Wash and dry the area before using the medication, and wash and dry your hands before and after you apply the medication.
Don't use on skin that's been cut or bleeding.
Avoid using near your face, underarms, or groin unless told to by your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a topical corticosteroid (anti-inflammatory medicine). It reduces redness, itching, and swelling caused by inflammatory skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone works well for itchy, red skin, but over time steroids can make your skin thin and prone to infections.
downsides: Can slow down wound healing.
Because it's a steroid, it can thin healthy skin and make it more susceptible to infections or cuts.

downsides_processed.orig: Can slow down wound healing.
Because it's a steroid, it can thin healthy skin and make it more susceptible to infections or cuts.

upsides: Effective at treating the itchiness and redness of rashes and skin irritation.
Available in generic.
Can be used with other medications if there is a skin infection.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at treating the itchiness and redness of rashes and skin irritation.
Available in generic.
Can be used with other medications if there is a skin infection.

drugs.name: Cutivate

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't use bandages that restrict airflow over the area where you apply the medication (unless your doctor tells you to).
Can slow down skin healing.
Wash and dry the area before using the medication, and wash and dry your hands before and after you apply the medication.
Don't use on skin that's been cut or bleeding.
Avoid using near your face, underarms, or groin unless told to by your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you are using Fluticasone, especially over a wide area of the skin for a long time and if you're using bandages that prevent airflow over the area. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Use this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
risk_factors: Using bandages that restrict airflow and using over a wide area of the skin for a long time

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you are using Fluticasone, especially over a wide area of the skin for a long time and if you're using bandages that prevent airflow over the area. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Use this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.

points.name: Infected eczema
points.hlt: skin structures and soft tissue infections

carousel_items: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

basics.benefits_moa: Nasonex is a topical steroid. It works directly where it's applied to help reduce swelling and inflammation in your nose.
basics.bottom_line: Nasonex is a good first-choice treatment for stuffy and runny noses caused by allergies, but it's not available as a generic so it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

userStories.tip: After three months of use, caused dry mouth.  I have used Flonase without this problem.
I changed insurance and the price went thru the roof. A pharmacist told me Nasocort is in the same family  (glucosteroid I think) and is non Rx. Working great so far!
switched to non Rx Nasocort and it works just as well.
Takes a while before it starts to work.  Don't wait until symptoms are bad to start taking it.

drugs.name: Nasonex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

risks_warnings.title: Thrush in the nose and throat
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in the nasal septum
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.

risks_warnings.title: Glaucoma and cataracts
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced immune system
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.
risk_factors: Exposure to immunizable diseases (chickenpox and measles)

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.

risks_warnings.title: Decrease in growth in children and teenagers
risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

carousel_items: Lowers inflammation and opens airways to improve breathing.
Starts working in about 30 minutes, but it can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Prevents asthma symptoms, but doesn't treat sudden wheezing or asthma attacks once they start.
Use inhaler in a level position, and don't breathe out into the device.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Shake inhaler for 5 seconds before you use it.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than a month since your last dose.
Call 911 or your doctor if it's hard to breathe or you have an asthma attack while on this medication.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

basics.benefits_moa: Advair is a combination medicine. Fluticasone (a corticosteroid) lowers lung inflammation to control asthma and COPD. Salmeterol (a bronchodilator) relaxes muscles in your lungs to open airways and make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Advair is good for people who need two medicines to control their asthma or COPD, but it might be expensive since there's no generic available.
downsides: You have to use Advair every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
The HFA inhaler isn't approved to treat COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Advair every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
The HFA inhaler isn't approved to treat COPD.
Can make your heart race.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
There have been some reports of worsening asthma leading to death when taking this medicine.

upsides: 2-in-1 medicine that lowers inflammation and opens airways in your lungs. Medicines are more effective together than alone.
Makes lung function significantly better.
Lowers the number of flare-ups and rescue inhaler uses in asthma and COPD.
You only have to use it twice a day.
Both the Diskus and inhaler can be used to treat asthma.

upsides_processed.orig: 2-in-1 medicine that lowers inflammation and opens airways in your lungs. Medicines are more effective together than alone.
Makes lung function significantly better.
Lowers the number of flare-ups and rescue inhaler uses in asthma and COPD.
You only have to use it twice a day.
Both the Diskus and inhaler can be used to treat asthma.

userStories.tip: Try to take it 12-14 hours apart twice daily.  wipe mouth piece weekly with alcohol wipe to keep clean.
Stopped my yearly hospitalizing asthma attacks

I wish I knew how much it cost before I said yes even though it is truly amazing I just can't afford it and have not hit my deductible so unfortunately I can't take it anymore but it was so great to breathe and not hug a rescue inhaler ever
Why do they want me to take spiria  too. Now my insurance won't help cover it.
Follow the directions!  Generic still quite a ways off.
Always rinse out your mouth!

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I experienced humming in my ears while taking.  Not worth it.  I was on minimum dose.  I quit taking it
it helps
I was getting nasal-brochital allergies aa mentioned by my doc, due to seasonal changes. Don't find it allergic at all, helped me a lot with my dry cough which was terribly bad.
userStories.identifier: trying to get in a healthy lifestyle

userStories.tip: The only problem I had with Advair was with my throat. It would always be dry and sore after I used it so I had to drink some water.
Don't skip doses. It makes a difference in the amount of gunk that builds up in my throat if I do.

drugs.name: Advair

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers inflammation and opens airways to improve breathing.
Starts working in about 30 minutes, but it can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Prevents asthma symptoms, but doesn't treat sudden wheezing or asthma attacks once they start.
Use inhaler in a level position, and don't breathe out into the device.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Shake inhaler for 5 seconds before you use it.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than a month since your last dose.
Call 911 or your doctor if it's hard to breathe or you have an asthma attack while on this medication.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

risks_warnings.title: Asthma-related death
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Advair. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Advair should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of worsening asthma leading to death in people taking Advair. It is related to one of the medications in this product. Advair should only be used if your symptoms have not improved with a fast-acting or controller medication alone. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Pneumonia
risks_warnings.description: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.
risk_factors: History of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
COPD includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema

description_processed.orig: Lung infections and pneumonia have been reported in people using Advair. It is important that your doctor check you since worsening of COPD symptoms may feel similar to pneumonia.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Advair too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Advair.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping Advair too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Advair too quickly which is related to one of the medications in the combination. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Advair.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: One of the medications in Advair may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.
risk_factors: Higher dose of the corticosteroid medication contained in Advair

description_processed.orig: One of the medications in Advair may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Advair may occur. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Advair, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.
risk_factors: Adverse effect of long-acting beta agonist drugs (LABAs), one of the medications in Advair, a combination drug.

description_processed.orig: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Advair may occur. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Advair, you may need to discuss increasing the dose or another medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart disease
risks_warnings.description: Advair may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Advair, you may need to change or stop this medication.
risk_factors: History of arrhythmia, hypertension or heart failure

description_processed.orig: Advair may increase blood pressure and heart rate, especially if you already have these conditions. These symptoms are related to one of the medications in this product so don't change or increase your dose without talking to your doctor first. Tell your doctor if you develop dizziness, tremor, nausea, rapid heartbeat, become very tired or have difficulty sleeping while taking Advair, you may need to change or stop this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of severe allergic reactions in people taking Advair who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Advair Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Advair. You should not use Advair Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of severe allergic reactions in people taking Advair who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Advair Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Advair. You should not use Advair Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

carousel_items: It can take several days for Fluticasone to start working fully.
Don't take more of it than was prescribed for you.
Blow your nose before using Fluticasone.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause a headache, sore throat, or nosebleeds.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a nasal steroid. It works directly in your nose to reduce swelling and inflammation caused by allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is a good first-choice medicine for treating a runny or stuffy nose caused by allergies, and it's cheaper than some alternatives.
downsides: Fluticasone doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Needs to be primed (pressed/pumped until a fine spray appears) up to six times prior to using it for the first time, or if you haven't used it in 2 weeks.
Since the medicine in Fluticasone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

downsides_processed.orig: Fluticasone doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Needs to be primed (pressed/pumped until a fine spray appears) up to six times prior to using it for the first time, or if you haven't used it in 2 weeks.
Since the medicine in Fluticasone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.
Available as a generic medication.

upsides_processed.orig: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.
Available as a generic medication.

userStories.tip: Has worked for me, reducing sinus infections from about four per year, to less than one. Seems to be most effective when used in conjunction with a nasal rinse. I do experience a side effect of reduced sensitivity to smell.

Always letting it expire and forgetting to use it, probably because I don't feel it working well right away. But when I actually use it regularly, for weeks, it does help with congestion. Use daily!!!

drugs.name: Flonase

carousel_items_processed.orig: It can take several days for Fluticasone to start working fully.
Don't take more of it than was prescribed for you.
Blow your nose before using Fluticasone.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause a headache, sore throat, or nosebleeds.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.
risk_factors: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used long term
Using other inhaled steroids with Fluticasone

description_processed.orig: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: People on this medication have reported wheezing, or nose and eye problems immediately taking after this medication. However, these reports are rare. If you notice problems breathing, pain in your nose, or changes in your vision, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

description_processed.orig: People on this medication have reported wheezing, or nose and eye problems immediately taking after this medication. However, these reports are rare. If you notice problems breathing, pain in your nose, or changes in your vision, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

carousel_items: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

userStories.tip: I should have been more aware of the risk of cataracts -- which I have developed in one eye, as a possible result of steroids in the bloodstream
I noticed 2 puffs is too strong for me and makes me completely sleepy, so I'm only using 1 of in the morning and it does stop the wheezing.

drugs.name: Flovent

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

description_processed.orig: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

description_processed.orig: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Fluticasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Fluticasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

description_processed.orig: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: Fluticasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Fluticasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

description_processed.orig: Fluticasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Fluticasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of new or worsening increased eye pressure, glaucoma and cataracts while taking Fluticasone. If you notice any changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.
risk_factors: History of high internal eye pressure

description_processed.orig: There are reports of new or worsening increased eye pressure, glaucoma and cataracts while taking Fluticasone. If you notice any changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: To load the Pulmicort inhaler for a dose, twist the brown grip as far as it will go both ways. When its ready, you will hear it click.
Be sure to rinse your mouth out after using Pulmicort. This will help decrease the chances of throat irritation, mouth infection, and loosing your voice.
Your Pulmicort inhaler comes with 60 or 120 doses. To make sure you have enough, check the dose indicator right under the mouthpiece.
You dont need to use a spacer with the Pulmicort inhaler. If you use other inhalers, ask your doctor what order to take them in.
Avoid asthma triggers like dust mites, pets, indoor mold, pollen, any type of smoke, and vacuum cleaning to protect your airways from being irritated.
Always have your rescue inhaler with you just in case you do have an asthma attack. Pulmicort will reduce your chances of having an asthma attack, but it won't completely get rid of them.

basics.benefits_moa: Pulmicort is an inhaled corticosteroid. It reduces inflammation in the inside lining in your airways by blocking the proteins that trigger inflammation.
basics.bottom_line: Pulmicort works well for long-term asthma control, but isn't a rescue inhaler (so it won't stop a sudden asthma attack).
downsides: Usually starts working in 1 to 2 days, but it can take up to 6 weeks before the full effects of Pulmicort are felt.
The medication wont work if it's not inhaled correctly, so make sure you're using the inhaler properly. A pharmacist can give you some help if you need it.
Some people get a stuffy nose, sore throat, or a cough when using Pulmicort.

downsides_processed.orig: Usually starts working in 1 to 2 days, but it can take up to 6 weeks before the full effects of Pulmicort are felt.
The medication wont work if it's not inhaled correctly, so make sure you're using the inhaler properly. A pharmacist can give you some help if you need it.
Some people get a stuffy nose, sore throat, or a cough when using Pulmicort.

upsides: In clinical studies, inhaled Pulmicort has been shown to increase FEV1 (the amount of air a person can forcibly blow out in 1 second) in people who have asthma.
Can be used with quick-acting asthma inhalers that'll open up your airways quickly in case of an attack.
The Pulmicort inhaler can be used in people 6 years and older.
Inhaled medications like Pulmicort work faster than pills, since it goes directly into your lungs.
Available as a generic inhaler.

upsides_processed.orig: In clinical studies, inhaled Pulmicort has been shown to increase FEV1 (the amount of air a person can forcibly blow out in 1 second) in people who have asthma.
Can be used with quick-acting asthma inhalers that'll open up your airways quickly in case of an attack.
The Pulmicort inhaler can be used in people 6 years and older.
Inhaled medications like Pulmicort work faster than pills, since it goes directly into your lungs.
Available as a generic inhaler.

userStories.tip: I wish I'd started on this.  I'm still a severe asthmatic, and must take ipratropium with albuterol/levalbuterol for rescue, but after switching to Pulmicort I've been able to stop Singulair, loratadine, and oral steroids.

drugs.name: Pulmicort

carousel_items_processed.orig: To load the Pulmicort inhaler for a dose, twist the brown grip as far as it will go both ways. When its ready, you will hear it click.
Be sure to rinse your mouth out after using Pulmicort. This will help decrease the chances of throat irritation, mouth infection, and loosing your voice.
Your Pulmicort inhaler comes with 60 or 120 doses. To make sure you have enough, check the dose indicator right under the mouthpiece.
You dont need to use a spacer with the Pulmicort inhaler. If you use other inhalers, ask your doctor what order to take them in.
Avoid asthma triggers like dust mites, pets, indoor mold, pollen, any type of smoke, and vacuum cleaning to protect your airways from being irritated.
Always have your rescue inhaler with you just in case you do have an asthma attack. Pulmicort will reduce your chances of having an asthma attack, but it won't completely get rid of them.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth infections
risks_warnings.description: Using Pulmicort can cause a fungal infection in the mouth known as candida albicans. It can be treated with oral or topical medications. To decrease your chances of this infection, be sure to rinse your mouth with water each time you use Pulmicort.

description_processed.orig: Using Pulmicort can cause a fungal infection in the mouth known as candida albicans. It can be treated with oral or topical medications. To decrease your chances of this infection, be sure to rinse your mouth with water each time you use Pulmicort.

risks_warnings.title: Acute asthma
risks_warnings.description: Pulmicort is not used for rapid relief of acute asthma. If your symptoms dont go away after using your regular short acting rescue inhaler, contact your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Pulmicort is not used for rapid relief of acute asthma. If your symptoms dont go away after using your regular short acting rescue inhaler, contact your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Pulmicort can cause a serious allergic reactions like skin rash, fever, swelling and trouble breathing. While this is rare, it is a life-threatening emergency. Get medical help right away. Pulmicort contains a small amount of lactose. For this reason, people with severe milk allergy should be careful if they have severe cough, wheezing, or tightness in their chest.

description_processed.orig: Pulmicort can cause a serious allergic reactions like skin rash, fever, swelling and trouble breathing. While this is rare, it is a life-threatening emergency. Get medical help right away. Pulmicort contains a small amount of lactose. For this reason, people with severe milk allergy should be careful if they have severe cough, wheezing, or tightness in their chest.

risks_warnings.title: Immunosuppresion
risks_warnings.description: Patients taking immunosuppressant medications like Pulmicort are more likely to develop infections. People who have not been vaccinated for diseases like chicken pox or measles should be careful to stay away from those infected.
risk_factors: Untreated systemic, viral, fungal, or bacterial infection

description_processed.orig: Patients taking immunosuppressant medications like Pulmicort are more likely to develop infections. People who have not been vaccinated for diseases like chicken pox or measles should be careful to stay away from those infected.

risks_warnings.title: Switching from oral corticosteroid
risks_warnings.description: People who are switching to inhaled Pulmicort from oral corticosteroids should slowly decrease their medication slowly. Quitting oral corticosteroids too quickly can cause an adrenal suppression and adrenal crisis. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy, low blood pressure, fever, confusion, and depression. Switching from oral corticosteroids can also lead to a condition called Churg-Strauss syndrome which can have symptoms of rash, heart pain, and breathing difficulty.

description_processed.orig: People who are switching to inhaled Pulmicort from oral corticosteroids should slowly decrease their medication slowly. Quitting oral corticosteroids too quickly can cause an adrenal suppression and adrenal crisis. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy, low blood pressure, fever, confusion, and depression. Switching from oral corticosteroids can also lead to a condition called Churg-Strauss syndrome which can have symptoms of rash, heart pain, and breathing difficulty.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased bone mineral density
risks_warnings.description: Taking Pulmicort for a long time can lead to decreased bone mineral density. This can lead to a increased risk of osteoporosis (weakened bones) and fractures. Exercise, good nutrition, and staying away from tobacco can help minimize this risk.

description_processed.orig: Taking Pulmicort for a long time can lead to decreased bone mineral density. This can lead to a increased risk of osteoporosis (weakened bones) and fractures. Exercise, good nutrition, and staying away from tobacco can help minimize this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Effect on growth
risks_warnings.description: Children who use Pulmicort for a long time can have stunted growth. Your doctor can help decrease this risk by giving your child the lowest dose necessary. This dose may need to be adjusted over time.

description_processed.orig: Children who use Pulmicort for a long time can have stunted growth. Your doctor can help decrease this risk by giving your child the lowest dose necessary. This dose may need to be adjusted over time.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Pulmicort can cause cataracts or glaucoma, increase eye pressure, and possibly cause eye nerve damage. Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain, or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Pulmicort can cause cataracts or glaucoma, increase eye pressure, and possibly cause eye nerve damage. Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain, or any vision changes.

points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Use daily to control your asthma symptoms.
Starts working the same day, but it can take up 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Pump the inhaler 2 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than 10 days since your last dose.
Wait one minute between doses.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Clean the mouthpiece with dry cloth once a week.
Talk to your doctor if asthma symptoms don't get better.

userStories.tip: Forced to switch to Qvar when my insurance stopped covering Flovent. I had 3 asthma attacks after not having a single one for several years.
I wish that I had known it works by lowering the immune system since I already have a weak immune system problem.
Sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, headaches and worsened breathing.

carousel_items: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

basics.benefits_moa: Lasix is a loop diuretic (water pill). It works in the kidneys to make you urinate more, which removes extra water and certain electrolytes. This lowers blood pressure and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Lasix is a very effective water pill and it'll certainly make you go to the bathroom more often.
downsides: Makes you urinate very frequently.
Can cause low levels of important electrolytes, such as potassium.

downsides_processed.orig: Makes you urinate very frequently.
Can cause low levels of important electrolytes, such as potassium.

upsides: A strong diuretic (water pill) that works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
Lowers your blood pressure and your risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works better than thiazide diuretics (like Hydrochlorothiazide) at removing harmful levels of certain electrolytes, such as potassium.
Okay to take if you have kidney problems.

upsides_processed.orig: A strong diuretic (water pill) that works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
Lowers your blood pressure and your risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works better than thiazide diuretics (like Hydrochlorothiazide) at removing harmful levels of certain electrolytes, such as potassium.
Okay to take if you have kidney problems.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure. Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I take Mirtazapine  (Remeron ) for depression.  Caused major edema so started lasix and water weight slid right off. Doc switched to Spironolactone,  and my edema is back full force. 9 lbs in 24 hrs and so painful in legs =(
Usually lots of urination during first hours of taking.
Take Lasix 20mg in am, rehydrate early am thru afternoon, then taper off H2O thru eve/ night. Helps limit amount of times one wakes up to pee at night.

drugs.name: Lasix

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Lasix can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, calcium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Lasix. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Too much Lasix can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, calcium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Lasix. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Lasix. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Lasix. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Hearing problems
risks_warnings.description: Lasix can cause ringing in the ears or trouble hearing. Use should be monitored by a healthcare provider especially if risk factors are present.
risk_factors: Other medicines that causes hearing problems

description_processed.orig: Lasix can cause ringing in the ears or trouble hearing. Use should be monitored by a healthcare provider especially if risk factors are present.

points.name: constipation
